name: @cf/black-forest-labs/flux-1-schnell
description: FLUX.1 [schnell] is a 12 billion parameter rectified flow transformer capable of generating images from text descriptions.

task.name: Text-to-Image
task.description: Generates images from input text. These models can be used to generate and modify images based on text prompts.

prompt.description: A text description of the image you want to generate

negative_prompt.description: Text describing elements to avoid in the generated image

height.description: The height of the generated image in pixels

width.description: The width of the generated image in pixels

image.description: For use with img2img tasks. An array of integers that represent the image data constrained to 8-bit unsigned integer values

image_b64.description: For use with img2img tasks. A base64-encoded string of the input image

mask.description: An array representing An array of integers that represent mask image data for inpainting constrained to 8-bit unsigned integer values

num_steps.description: The number of diffusion steps; higher values can improve quality but take longer

strength.description: A value between 0 and 1 indicating how strongly to apply the transformation during img2img tasks; lower values make the output closer to the input image

guidance.description: Controls how closely the generated image should adhere to the prompt; higher values make the image more aligned with the prompt

seed.description: Random seed for reproducibility of the image generation

image.description: The generated image in Base64 format.
